DataElement.preferredName: Complete Remission Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation Response Occurrence Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to if a complete remission was ever achieved in response to the HCT.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Complete Remission Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation Response Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.  This does not always mean the cancer has been cured._Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_The grafting of tissues from one individual to another or place to place within a single individual._Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense.: The chemotherapy and/or radiation given to bone marrow transplant patients prior to transplant to kill diseased cells and/or make space for healthy new marrow and/or suppress the immune system so graft rejection does not occur.: A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.  This does not always mean the cancer has been cured.

Concepts.definition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.

The chemotherapy or radiation given prior to blood, marrow, cord blood transplant, or cell infusion to kill diseased cells and make space for the healthy new graft and/or suppress the immune system so rejection does not occur.
A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.
The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.
